isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 2000, 4000, 8000 - ELECTRONIC ENGINES, CUMMINS M11E AND N14E - OPERATION - CELECT Warning Lights

svcsubproc.title: Red Oil/Water Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: The Oil/Water Warning light is part of the Engine Protection system (refer to Engine Protection Systems above).
The light is located in the instrument cluster. The cluster receives ignition voltage (key on) at conn. (26), terminal 5, circuit 28E. Circuit 28E receives power from relay (R1-B).
The ground side of the Oil/Water warning light is powered through connector (26) by circuit 97AZ to ECM connector (320) terminal 1.
The Oil/Water warning light is turned on and off by the ECM opening or closing a ground switch in response to engine conditions.

note.para: With the key on, engine off, and diagnostic switch off, the light comes on for two seconds and then goes off as a system test.

svcsubproc.title: Yellow Engine Warning Light
svcsubproc.para: The Engine Warning Light is part of the On-Board Diagnostics system (refer to On-Board Diagnostics or TROUBLESHOOTING Charts.)

The Engine Warning Light is located in the left instrument cluster. The cluster receives ignition voltage (key on) at connector (26), terminal 4, circuits 28 and 28K. Circuits 28 and 28K receive power from the Ignition switch (24) which is protected by 5A fuse F6.
The Engine Warning light is connected through connector (26), terminal 12 by circuit 97AT to ECM connector (320) terminal 25.
The Engine Warning light is turned on and off by the ECM opening or closing a ground switch in response to engine conditions.

note.para: With the key on, engine off, and diagnostic switch off, the light comes on for two seconds and then goes off as a system test.

svcsubproc.title: Red Stop Engine Light
svcsubproc.para: The red Stop Engine Light is part of the On-Board Diagnostics system or refer to TROUBLESHOOTINGCharts.

The Stop Engine light is located in the left instrument cluster. The cluster receives ignition voltage (key on) at connector (26), terminal 4, circuits 28 and 28K. These circuits receive power from the key switch (24) and are protected by 5A fuse F6.
The Stop Engine light is connected through connector (26) terminal 11 by circuit 97AP to ECM connector (320) terminal 16.
The Stop Engine light is turned on and off by the ECM opening or closing a ground switch in response to engine conditions.

note.para: With the key on, engine off, and diagnostic switch off, the light comes on for two seconds and then goes off as a system test.
